page.title: 14WALKER'S COACHES, ANDERTON.
page.content: We decided to interview Walker's Ltd. because it is the main coach company providing school transport in the area. Mrs. Vicky Walker was a teacher and her husband was a butcher when, in 1964, they were in York and saw a bus. It was purple and white and they liked the look of it, so they decided to start a company of their own. They realized there would be a lot of business with schools. They now have a fleet of 42 coaches, costing between Â£60,000 and Â£80,000. Sixteen people are employed in the office plus all their drivers. They buy approximately 6,000 gallons of fuel every six weeks. Most of their business is conducted in this country but they are branching out into Continental travel and it is hoped the firm will expand further, providing more local employment.
